ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I've learnt a lot of Italian and became able to have basic conversations, which was an amazing experience!
Italian grammar, vocab, reading, writing and speaking

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I don't think this course has any weaknesses. It taught me a lot of Italian very quickly and was very fun. It can feel a bit fast paced at times but that's by the nature of summer courses and was never overwhelming. Also, the instructors were always willing to help!

Strengths: the instructors were great. They were always willing to work with us and our schedules.
Weakness: I think we could've had more speaking practice throughout the course and less English use.

One of the best classes I have had at Yale. The Interactive and communicative nature of the class truly turned us into a community. The main strength of the class was definitely our instructor-duo! Teresa always went out of her way to support us in and out of the class however she could, and Antonio balanced out our craziness with his calm and formal nature.

The only weakness would be that there is no true separation between L1 and L2 and therefore it is the same grade for the 3 credits at the end of the cumulative final. I think separating L1 and L2 by putting a midterm (final for L1)  will be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely!!! If you get a chance to go to Siena for a summer and genuinely want to pick up some Italian, you should totally do it. Don't expect a summer where you chill in Italy but also don't be scared of it - it's gonna be amazing.
Yes. It's a great way to start learning Italian

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
